com.fincons.mqtt.client.service

Class MessagePublisherService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fincons.mqtt.client.service.MessagePublisherService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback

    public class MessagePublisherService
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttCallback
    This class implements the interface MqttCallback and provides the method to perform an MQTT message publish operation in a secure way or in clear. This class includes the CP-ABE/AES security aspects; in particular the encryption keys generation and the encryption message features.
    Author:
    leonardo.straniero

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connectionLost(java.lang.Throwable me)
      This method implements the business logic of the client when it loses the connection with the MQTT Broker Server.
      void deliveryComplete(org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.IMqttDeliveryToken iMqttDeliveryToken)
      This method implements the business logic of the publisher client when the message is delivered to the MQTT Broker Server.
      static MessagePublisherService getInstance()
      Returns the single instance of this class implemented according to the singleton pattern.
      void messageArrived(java.lang.String s, org.eclipse.paho.client.mqttv3.MqttMessage mqttMessage)
      This method provides the business logic implemented in the client subscriber when a new message is delivered to the topic selected.
      void publishMessage(java.lang.String topic, org.json.JSONObject message)
      This method publishes a message to a topic on the MQTT Broker Server and returns once it is delivered.

      • publishMessage

        public void publishMessage(java.lang.String topic,
                           org.json.JSONObject message)
        This method publishes a message to a topic on the MQTT Broker Server and returns once it is delivered.
        Parameters:
        topic - - topic to deliver the message to, for example "finance/stock/ibm"
        message - - the string to use as the payload
